docs.text: i remember hearing about this film when it first appeared at cannes over a year ago , picking up the grand jury prize at the festival .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: 'holocaust comedy receives standing ovation' , the headlines read .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: intrigued by this statement , i looked up information on the film and found that , sure enough , life is beautiful is in fact a comedy about the greatest atrocity of the last thousand years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even though the movie was extremely well-received by critics and public alike , i couldn't help but be disgusted at this notion ; human tragedy is not something i feel should be celebrated .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: only now do i see the error of my ways .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after finally viewing the film for myself after avoiding it for some time , it became clear that it is not , as the headlines proclaimed , a " holocaust comedy " ; on the contrary , life is beautiful does not even really depict the graphic events that took place in nazi deathcamps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: rather , it focuses on the relationship between a father and his son , who he is trying desperately to shield from the horrors of their situation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: roberto benigni ( who also wrote and directed the movie ) stars as guido orefice , a chaplin-inspired clown and all round jolly guy who , as the film opens , is vying for the affections of an attractive school teacher ( nicoletta braschi , benigni real life spouse ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: through the course of the first hour or so , we see guido striving to get the attention of this " beautiful princess " , as he calls her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: employing the magic of laughter , the italian comedian wins her heart and together , they raise a young boy named giosue ( child actor giorgio cantarini ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: life treats them well until hitler's minions rise to power , and the family is whisked away to a german camp , where guido becomes convinced that he must upholds his son's innocence no matter what the sacrifice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: granted , it contains some uproariously funny moments both in and out of the concentration camp , but it does not pull a " hogan's heros " and make light of the slaughtering of some six million innocent jews .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: somehow , it achieves hilarity without disrespecting it's gravely serious subject .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so , we've established that life is beautiful is not a " holocaust comedy " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but , there is another complete misrepresentation of this material that really disturbs me .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film , despite critic's declarations of it being a " triumph of the human spirit " , is no such thing ; not in my eyes , anyway .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some have called the story an " affirmation of the beauty of life " , but i say it is a very dark and bleak statement about man's capability of denial masquerading as an endearing comedy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film's ending has been recognized as the most entirely uplifting moment of any film released recently , but i found it to be truly discerning and upsetting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: essentially , life is beautiful is quite possibly the greatest hoax in the history of film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , i am not denying the movie's greatness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: believe me , it's fantastic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'm just saying that i think benigni did something different than what most people are interpreting it as .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but perhaps i'm reading more into the movie than is really there .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maybe the film's brilliance relies on the idea that the viewer can interpret the meaning of it in any way they see fit .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , maybe roberto benigni has made a film that is the sole argument for the old saying that you get out of a movie exactly what you put into it .
docs.label: positive
